introduction: Acacia ammobia, commonly known as the Mount Connor wattle,[3] or Mount Conner wattle,[4] is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae and is endemic to areas near the border between South Australia and the Northern Territory. It is a shrub or small tree with linear phyllodes, flowers arranged in 1 or 2 spikes on side shoots, each spike with densely crowded yellow flowers. The fruit is a linear pods 55110 mm (2.24.3 in) long with dar brown seeds.
